website_summaries.verdict: A durable and quick-use blood pressure monitor that's easy on the eyes.
pros: Screen is easy to read, making it great for users with less than perfect vision
Long lasting, even with travel and repeated use
cons: Some users report that readings are higher with this device than at the doctor's office

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am a healthcare professional and I prefer the wrist blood pressure monitor. This one has been fabulous. I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate! Shows too hight of a value
customer_reviews.text: Totally inaccurate. I gave this device a few weeks of testing. I tried different methods of using it and different levels of tightness. I even had a nurse help me use it correctly. It always shows a way too high value. Over the last weeks I measured my blood pressure daily and it was always around 130/80. That's way higher than I ever had at any doctors visit. So today I had my doctor measure my blood pressure again and it was 100/60. Came back home tried this device again several times and it shows 135/85. Not even close.
customer_reviews.author: David Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: light
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse, good cuff, works well. I still do a manual if I do not like the numbers.
customer_reviews.author: herb compton

customer_reviews.title: Blood Pressure Cuff
customer_reviews.text: As one of your other reviews recommended to lay down when taking your blood pressure, I found works best at getting an accurate reading. Very please with this product.
customer_reviews.author: kaswartz

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the wrist monitor out a lot in the last few days. I would get it five stars- it's easy to use, sturdy, and seems to give very consistent results. I've compared it to conventional blood pressure cuffs and it seems accurate. Also, the red/yellow/green indicator on the left side is a nice feature. My one suggestion would be to have the screen backlit for darker settings.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great little cuff!
customer_reviews.text: Great little cuff. Very user friendly. So easy to use without assistance. Digital display is large and clear. Only drawback is that the display does not light up so you need to be in a lit room to read the display. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A Eakin

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate reading, be careful
customer_reviews.text: suffering from high blood pressure and I thought this could help a lot. Turns out, the only thing it can't help you. I received it last Thursday while I was at the hospital and I tested it for a week under the nurse's direction and what was upsetting is that it constantly showed different variations of 200+ (210/220/240,etc) and 135+ (140/150/170). Thankfully I was at the hospital and my nurse compared the reading with their monitor which was 138/89. How can a device be so off? Even my girl friend who has perfect blood pressure tried, and it showed all different numbers of her typical readings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrist needs to be level with heart.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you have your wrist chest height or you will get crazy readings.
customer_reviews.author: Mike bryant

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Consistent
customer_reviews.text: So I realize that I have to be still, just like when I'm at a Dr.'s office when using this or I'll get varying responses. When I do that, it's pretty consistent. I appreciate the portability and ease of use. It has memory and large buttons, with not too much going on to confuse. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: CaliSD

customer_reviews.title: checks with my other brand i have
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be about the same as my bp monitor i have checked with the dr.'s office. It's a little less convenient to use then what i'm use to but working well.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Pitchford

customer_reviews.title: convenient
customer_reviews.text: So far I would rate the item a 4 out of 5. I like the convenience of the small portable size and the fact that it is easier to use by yourself (alone) than an arm cuff. It is not as easy to get it on just right as I was hoping though...maybe that is because I have small wrists (only 5 3/4 inches) and I have to try a few times to get it tight enough. I believe I am getting an accurate reading and I hope to compare it with what I get when I go to a health care appointment.
customer_reviews.author: tica

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate readings
customer_reviews.text: My wife purchased this to monitor her BP while on a high risk pregnancy medication. She figured it would be easier than using her manual cuff (she's a Nurse Practitioner, so we have these things laying around the house). This device was wildly off, on every occasion where we tried to even get an average. The bottom line, it does not work. It's a great idea, but if you are tracking your BP for a real medical situation, this is NOT the device for it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work! Totally inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: Received this monitor as gift, but it was totally off, I hope. First time I used it, I had 199/147, thought I was about to have a heart attack. It fluctuated up and down by 50 points, absolutely irregular and inaccurate. Do not recommend this for blood pressure at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Read instructions first!
customer_reviews.text: This is so simple to operate I thought I only had to put it on and press "start". There are some guidelines one should follow to get an accurate reading, and indeed, my results changed when I took a minute to follow the instructions. Very easy to use by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: RTFM and don’t panic
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, very fast and easy to read if eyesight is < 20/20. Reported BP can be sensitive to wrist location relative to heart muscle so don’t have a heart attack if it comes in high. Best reproducibility and accuracy of value was obtained with left wrist kept dead level with chest while sitting in a recliner. Otherwise measurements could be > 150% higher than my historical average BP.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Hyland Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy dangerous to your health.
customer_reviews.text: This product could be extremely dangerous please be careful. We read my husband‘s blood pressure five times within 10 minutes and got five different readings. One was as high as 250/100. When in reality his blood pressure was 118/70. They should not be allowed on the market. If someone gets a normal blood pressure and it’s extremely high or vice versa this could kill someone. We bought this when we got home from the hospital after my husband suffered a heart attack I am extremely upset that it did not get accurate readings.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Rosero

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, fast reading. A no brainer
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent. From 1 to 5, I would definitely rate it 5, being 5 the best qualification. Compared with other brands that I have used in the past, I like this one better because takes measurement faster, it has a big display, the who feature is super practical and the product is not as heavy as the last one I was using. Definitely happy with the buy. Wasn't expecting so much from a brand I didn't know but it was worth the try. Thanks for a quality product and more than accessible price. It has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Maximo b

customer_reviews.title: BP readings are not accurate vs home and clinic pressure cuff
customer_reviews.text: The unit is good manufacturing quality and easy to use but I could NOT trust the readings re: (1) inconsistent when doing multiple checks in the same time period (2) NOT ACCURATE in side by side comparison with home pressure cuff device and drug store pressure cuff reading I wish it was accurate and consistent since it's so easy to use and store but we cannot risk our health vs. the concerns above, I am returning the device :(
customer_reviews.author: Doug_Seattle

customer_reviews.title: BP. Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, simple directions, and set up. Easy to utilize every day to check your bp.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C Carroll

customer_reviews.title: It is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I was diagnosed with high blood presser and my Doctor suggested I buy a blood pressure cup. I was on medication so when I got my tester I assumed my medication was working well. I decided to take my tester to the Doctors and check to there testers. I was 40 points different. And by the time I figured that out it was to late to return. Don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Kleinknecht

customer_reviews.title: So glad I lost my first wrist blood pressure cuff.
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse recently lost a wrist blood pressure cuff I had which I use quite a bit for teaching nursing assistant students. I teach both manual methods but also expose my students to the digital equipment out there. This cuff was not only easy to use, but was quicker than my last one and not so movement picky. My last cuff would error if some moved or spoke. This cuff is much for tolerate which is great for those dementia patients who tend to easily become distracted. I love this cuff and have used it quite a bit out in the field with much accuracy. Will be seeking out other products from ParaMed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and pretty accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for a week since I got it. It is very easy use - the instructions are simple and clear and you wear it on wrist instead of upper arm. I have also travelled with it. The size including the protective box is small enough to fit into my carry on suitcase. I have also compared its readings to another blood pressure monitor at the local health clinic and the data are very comparable.
customer_reviews.author: X. Deng

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very accurate as is match my BP at the Dr office. Quick fill and read as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: value
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I received this device, I tried and it worked so good and accurate as hospital. It is really worthy and helpful for my family. It was so easy to program and read numbers. One bad thing is the "battery cover" is so loose(does not fit right) and came off from body, so I put tape on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: James Han

customer_reviews.title: Works great and so convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using an arm cuff monitor for 11 years now and this wrist monitor is just the best. Can't imagine why I would not have defected years ago. So convenient too. I took in to my doctor's visit earlier this week to reconcile with the RN (registered nurse) taking my blood pressure manually, and my wrist monitor was accurate by comparison when checking two minutes after the manual check. Never going back to an arm cuff monitor if I can help it. Love the form and function of this nifty device.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Iggy

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and portable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. The display is informative. Heart rate is spot on accurate across other device comparisons. HOWEVER - My unit consistently reads 10-15 points lower on Diastome and 10-15 points hgoher on systole when compared to arm cuff monitors. Asa group, wrist cuffs seem to be very sensitive to arm position so it is important to make sure the monitor is at heart level and your arm is straight. Despite the differences I use it as a convenience to evaluate trends in my BP status. Batteries last a long time and are easy to change.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rabinowitz

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: easy to open to put batteries in and easy t o wirk.
customer_reviews.author: sheila mizrahi

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is an essential for every household. Setting it up was easy and its backlit On/OFF and Memory buttons are easily identified even in dark environments. I have been using this daily for almost a month and I can say that is very accurate and extremely convenient to carry everywhere. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: CustomerHLG

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: I am a home health RN so I take a lot of BPs throughout the day. This cuff is usually accurate, but I always keep my manual cuff with me in case I have doubts that it’s a false reading. You have to keep your arm very still, above your heart for it to read correctly. So if you have a wiggly or forgetful elderly patient it’s sometimes hard to get an accurate reading. I give it 4 star bc I have to manually recheck atleast 2-3 times a week, but it’s very easy to use and the screen is bright and easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Just received subject unit in the mail this AM. It’s very similar to the old unit (OMRON), which is now being replaced after fifteen years. New PARAMED unit runs on (2) AAA batteries. So far, it works great. Very easy to read display. Also appears to be more accurate; a subjective assessment, based on comparative readings with cuff type upper arm unit. Product appears well made and is expected to last for many years. Thanks for the very nice and functional product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because of ease of use. I have a cuff that is a pain trying to keep straight and in the right position. It is easy to use...slap it on and push the button while holding your hand in the right position. The handy storage box even has pictures showing you how to do it. The problem is that it isn't accurate. It reads my blood pressure as 10 below my actual blood pressure. Because my blood pressure can fluctuate this is a problem regarding whether or not to take my medicine. I can't find the box to return it so I guess it will sit on the shelf unused.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: READ AND HEED.
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate. Off by 20-30 on top number. Checked against a sphygmomanometer several dozen times. IF you decide to use one of these check it with a sure fire method. Have a health care professional verify it with you. Otherwise DO NOT rely on one of these. Dangerous. By the reviews some seem to work. Some not.
customer_reviews.author: The Rabble

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but didn’t work out for me
customer_reviews.text: I personally did not find this product to be very accurate. Results varied significantly from my wife’s readings when she used a traditional bp cuff and stethoscope. She’s a RN and knows how to take a BP reading so I trust her reading more than this machine. Obviously many of these automatic type cuffs have some level of user error but I had another automatic cuff in the past that offered far more accurate readings without much effort. I just wasn’t really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: thos25

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I love this blood pressure machine it is the best as far as accuracy but it must be made cheap because the arm part has already broken and when I went to order the arm part it says, they don’t know when it will be in stock.. I spent money on another one and most of them don’t work as well and you can’t play around with blood pressure.. So I’m all the way back to my doctors office every time I have to get my pressure checked 🤨
customer_reviews.author: Honestly

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the product for the price
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: Check with your doctor before using ANY home medical device. We bought my Paramed wrist blood pressure monitor and love it-use it every day. It beats wrestling with a old-fashioned blood pressure cuff and is much easier to pack when traveling. In fact, a nurse I know liked mine so well, she bought one for herself and put her old BP cuff on the shelf. If you need to check your blood pressure, this is a product you'll like. REMEMBER: Check with your health care professional before using ANY home medical device.
customer_reviews.author: R2

customer_reviews.title: A novelty toy
customer_reviews.text: How is this FDA approved? How are the reviews even decent? I've tried others like this and they all have the same inaccuracy issues. One minute it'll say like 205/125, the very next 118/80. Completely useless. Edit 9/28/2020 - 128/72 on the wrist cuff. Stroke level reality at the doc - 194/102. This thing is absolutely useless and I hope they get sued over this "FDA approved" fraud.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Much better than last wrist monitor I bought
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a different wrist monitor that was majorly inaccurate. Didn't like the reading? Just do it until you get the results you wanted. Not good. (I had my bp tested at my doctor's office, 113/72, then tried that monitor ... 158/102. Retrying I could not get it down to the doctor's read. (I returned the unit and bought this one.) This monitor, however, has been very consistent. I haven't had a chance to test it against my doctor's machine, but at least all the readings I take are about the same. Bottom line, I am happy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bastian

customer_reviews.title: far better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an easy to use blood pressure cuff. I was an EMT for over 30 years and I have never liked "automatic" BP cuffs, even those in the hospital ER's. Based on reviews and overall features, I gave this one a try. First thing I found is "FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS". Failure to do so results in inaccurate readings. When used properly, I was able to get consistent readings when measured against a manual BP Cuff. I also had my daughter-in-law, who is a nurse do the same with the same results. This thing works well, I'm happy and my doctor will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to use machine for seniors
customer_reviews.text: I'm a caregiver and I bought this for the woman I work with. She's had it for about 3 weeks now. She has a larger wrist and says it's MUCH more comfortable than the one she had previously. The display is easy for her to read which was another problem with the old one. It also seems pretty accurate, a bit lower than at the Dr's which is to be expected. The one bummer was how quickly the batteries died, we had to change them just the other day. We put new brand name batteries in it, so hoping the batteries were cheapies.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Not for any clinical setting or anyone who adjust medications according to BP
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse practitioner who is hard of hearing so I have used an electronic bicep sphingometer for some time with great success. However, mine just retired itself. I though I would try this out since it is so well-reviewed. I have used it at least 8 times a day for the past 2.5 days and now am back to my good'ol bulb pump cuff. This thing is widely inaccurate with most readings, which have been confirmed with use of the patient's home bp monitor and my hand-pump type. I would only advise this for home use in otherwise healthy individuals.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Well built and very nice but it didn't work for me...
customer_reviews.text: This BP wrist monitor is very nice. Well built and a nice design. It's very easy to use but the problem I had with it was the accuracy of the BP reading. I know what my blood pressure normally read and the BP monitor had my readings very low. So I went to my nearest drug store, first I use this monitor and I use the drug store monitor and just as I thought this monitor was completely off. So today I returned this monitor....
customer_reviews.author: AJ Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not consistent or accurate
customer_reviews.text: I waited too long to return this item..so I am stuck with a bad product (Paramed wrist BP monitor) . I have been using BP monitors for years, this is the most inaccurate one ever. I get readings that are very low and then minutes later very high . Sometimes just the opposite. There is no pattern about what to expect. I finally took it to my Doctor appointment and compared. The doctor said stop using it it is "dangerous to your health". He said to find a more consistent monitor..So I am out the money and now I try to find one that is more dependable. live and learn...
customer_reviews.author: Good Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Plus-Size People, Accurate & Easy to Read & Use!!
customer_reviews.text: *Small, Compact & Light *Easy to travel with (comes w/a portable box) *Accurate Readings *Has a memory that even records TIME & DATE *Easy to use by yourself * Big Print, Easy to read & see *If you're plus size, you don't have to worry about cuff bring too tight, as it goes around wrist Great equipment to carry anywhere I like that I can carry this anywhere I go. It's light and fits in a small box. I tested this against my doctors blood pressure cuff & found it was equally accurate. Nice to have one of these in the home.
customer_reviews.author: Top Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Received my automatic wrist blood pressure monitor with fast delivery. This cuff is great. No more having to have my arm hurt due to an arm cuff especially when the arm cuff does not get a first time read. This wrist cuff fits comfortably and never squeezes nor causes pain. First read every time. Love the color coding that tells if I'm in the safe or danger zone. Many great features. I would recommend this automatic wrist blood pressure monitor cuff from Paramed to everyone needing a BP cuff.
customer_reviews.author: Trina

customer_reviews.title: In cardiac arrest! But not really.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this review 2 stars because I love how the product looks and how easy it was to use. Plus, the seller offered free returns which is great because I will be returning it. After multiple tries on all of my family it turns out we are all on death’s doorstep. Unless of course the blood pressure of my 15-year-old isn’t actually 240/150. 😳 I suppose everyone is different, but this was completely inaccurate and read ridiculously high.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Paramed:Blood-Pressure Kit Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Few days ago I have purchased Paramed:Blood-Pressure Kit from Amazon.com. I got the unit today and I just want to say I am so pleasantly surprised, by the quality of the unit, the instruction, the simplicity and accuracy of the unit. I have several blood pressure units and I am so happy to say Paramed:Blood-Pressure Kit I just purchased is extremely accurate, very easy to use, came with clear setup instruction and it is just perfect. Cannot ask for anything more. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mastercard

customer_reviews.title: Reading is surely inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: After comparing this to my husband's Panasonic, I have found the accuracy to be way off. (He actually took his with him to the doctor's office to verify accuracy, and it was within 1 millimeter of theirs!) The difference was 20 millimeters when I took readings 7 times! And it was way lower than the readings at the drugstore and doctor's office that prompted me to get a monitor. Unfortunately, I will be returning this monitor and seeking another.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: It works great, but you HAVE to use it exactly correctly
customer_reviews.text: At first I figured that it worked the same way as in the dentist office--slap it on your wrist, hold it over your chest and that's it. No. Read the directions. The cuff must be on the left wrist and the screen must be on the inside of the wrist. Then the wrist must be held away from your body with the cuff level to your heart. Once you get that sequence right, the device is very reliable. The directions are marked clearly inside the cuff's carry box, but you have to follow them!!! ; >
customer_reviews.author: whoelse

customer_reviews.title: Great product to check your blood pressure accurately on your own
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to use, came with its own storage container, AND batteries. There were 3 sets of instructions, so if you are new to checking your blood pressure, it takes the guess work out of it. Device itself was small, comfortable and easy to use. No real fumbling as it goes and conforms to your wrist and material was soft. The screen for the readings is easy to understand. Was overall impressed with the product, am glad to be able to avoid doing it with the arm cuff since it's slightly harder to do that on your own. Definitely recommend, it's accurate and great in its simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Bebakins

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time the Charm
customer_reviews.text: The current monitor I have is perfect for my needs. I track my BP twice a day due to the medication I take. The first monitor I received did not inflate and indicated a error message to replace. Using Amazon's return and replace option online I arranged for a replacement. The very next day I received my new unit and instructions to return the defective unit to our local Kohl's for them to return to Amazon. Very easy process. Returns happen sometimes... Amazon's return policy is great and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Barr

customer_reviews.title: 5 star review
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased 1 Automatic Wrist Blood Pressure Monitor by Paramed:Blood-Pressure Kit of Bp Cuff + 2AAA and Carrying case - Irregular Heartbeat Detector & 90 Readings Memory Function & Large LCD Display - FDA approved and I’m very pleased with the product. I have an 8 1⁄2 inch wrist and this device fits well and works well for me, and there is plenty of room with this wrist cuff so anyone with large wrists should not hesitate to purchase this product. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: B2

customer_reviews.title: Good blood pressure monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Good portable blood pressure monitor to carry in your bag, purse, backpack, or just to have in the house for a quick blood pressure check. User friendly and easy to read the information. Reading is fairly accurate. I would recommend this blood pressure monitor to any medical professional that needs a quick point of care assessment for their patients. Or for anyone that is concerned with their own health, or need to keep track of their blood pressure on a daily, weekly or monthly basis.
customer_reviews.author: dupita

customer_reviews.title: A great wrist blood pressure monitor
customer_reviews.text: I really like the product because : It is easy to operate; gives the readings of blood presures quickly, about 30% faster than another brand blood press monitor we have been using; the digital LCD display is large, clear, and easy to read; the shape of the cuff is well desigened and is comfortable to wear; and the carry case is great for protection of the monitor and convenient for travel too. Based up these positive features I would strongly recommend this product and would give it a 5 rating as it deserves.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had blood pressure concerns since he was diagnosed with Dystonia, and over the years it has gotten more erratic. Sometimes it is high(190 +) other times low (92). His BP meds have been changed several times, and it does ok for a while, Problem was he had to walk across room and up 2 steps to get to BP monitor from his chair. There is no place to put monitor near his chair. I am always worried about him falling cause he gets dizzy, and won;t stop walking. This BP monitor can sit near him and be handy.
customer_reviews.author: grnsnma

customer_reviews.title: Accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: I like that you wear it in your wrist instead of upper arm. You know, sometimes you have to remove your jacket or pull up your long sleeves so you can strap it around your upper arm. Let’s be honest, what if you are wearing a long thick jacket? By the time you remove it you might be out of breath or your heart is beating fast. (It happened to me couple times at the doctors office) and then the reading is all wrong and you start all over. This device is very easy to use, wrap around your wrist and press the ON button and that’s it! Wait for your results. Accurate reading and not too expensive. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DinoBerryCake

customer_reviews.title: accurate BP readings
customer_reviews.text: Good easy to read display & set up pretty easy (although instructions weren't real easy) but most important, this cuff was compared to another instrument that I know is pretty accurate & they agreed right on with systolic (upper) number & was within 2 of diastolic (lower) number. Received in one day, too!
customer_reviews.author: willies

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Very inaccurate monitor. Constantly showed a reading 30-40 points below doctors test. Went thru 3 of these and all acted the same. Ist was bad, sent it back to Amazon and requested a replacement. Replacement acted the same as the first. Notified Paramed of the problem and they also sent me a new one. Same results. Followed directions to the letter and still got the same results. Compared readings to both my doctors and dentists results. Always 30-40 points below.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fairly accurate
customer_reviews.text: For w/e reason in life I went from having high BP to low BP. I changed my life style and eating drastically over the years. I couldn't believe how low my numbers were, so I ended up verifying with other devices, and even my doctor. This seems to be fairly accurate. Today the device did this weird thing where it checked my BP, then immediately pumped back up showing me a unrealistic number in the 200s.
customer_reviews.author: ClaytonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing blood pressure monitor!
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is perfect for me. Easy to use, easy to read and accurate with in-depth instructions and information about blood pressure. I took the monitor to my doctor's office and had them check the accuracy. The blood pressure, heart rate and oxygen rate were all correct. My doctor tested it on herself too. She said it is one of the best home monitors that she has come across. Thank you for providing such a fine product. Thank you for listing it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M

customer_reviews.title: Great device.
customer_reviews.text: Some idiot doctor diagnose me with high blood pressure, no other tests only by what I told him about a couple of headaches and try to give me drugs to control it , I decide not to take the medicine and monitor my pressure for over 3 months, not 1 single time I got high pressure, it turn out I need new glasses. WTF happen with doctors in US, just incredible. Awesome device, totally recommend it to monitor at least 3 times a day to be sure.
customer_reviews.author: MTB_LA

customer_reviews.title: Great little Blood Pressure reader
customer_reviews.text: We had been using a traditional cuff and scope to do readings but the dial was getting a bit hard to read so I thought we'd give this a try. Great little product, easy to use, one button operation and with the cuff gong around your wrist it is just too easy. I am not sure if the presssure reads differently from the arm to the wrist but it does seem to be reading right where I would expect my BP to be. Overall very happy with the purchase, especially at the price. I gave it a 4 on accuracy just because I have nothing to confirm it with.
customer_reviews.author: Daviddjp

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I'm a home health nurse and this is wondrous in assessing BP for stable patients. No back lit is a minus but I was already aware of that. It measures BP in less than a minute and it's paramed. nothing else really.
customer_reviews.author: Christian B.

customer_reviews.title: Appears To Be Right
customer_reviews.text: I use these for family purposes, they match up a lot with manual BP when done with guidance from the instructions (Be sure to follow them, I've found small deviations to lead to different BPs). The case is very compact, about the size of a softball, so it's easy to pack and transport.
customer_reviews.author: LeCario Benashley

customer_reviews.title: Does not have a backlit screen
customer_reviews.text: The Mem., Set, and On/Off buttons are backlit, but the screen itself is not. It's an absolutely bizarre design flaw that makes it impossible to read in a darkish room. I don't understand how they could possibly think this is ok.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Easy monitoring for you and the family!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because i need to monitor my blood pressure because of my pregnancy. The good thing about the wrist BP monitor is you can use it yourself and don’t need any assistance especially if you’re alone and had to take your blood pressure at that moment. The arm monitor they said is more accurate than the wrist but i double check it with my arm monitor to see if they will have the same readings. And to my surprised, they almost have the same numbers when i took my blood pressure at the same time. If you want to monitor your blood pressure by yourself then I recommend this machine to you..
customer_reviews.author: Sharl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, easy to use, accurate readings at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to take to Argentina as a gift to my 96 years old uncle. He used it daily and he loved how easy and convenient it was to get his readings. The grip was very comfortable, the screen easy to read. He proudly showed it to a couple of his neighbors, as he is in excellent shape thus far and able to walk and set it up by himself. My aunt tried it too and was also very pleased with it and its accurate readings. I will purchase a couple more for my upcoming trip back to Argentina, to gift to other relatives too. Thanks for an excellent product at an affordable price. You change people’s lives!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent B/P monitor
customer_reviews.text: I received the wrist B/P monitor and was very impressed. It came with a nice case to keep it clean. Being a medical professional, I was impressed also with its ease of use and accuracy. This is my fourth B/P monitor having gone through several of the larger type arm monitors which did not last and the accuracy was questionable. The instructions were well written and easy to understand. I would highly recommend this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Easy!!
customer_reviews.text: I received the wrist blood pressure monitor today. I easily installed the batteries that came with the monitor. I read the simple directions that accompanied the monitor. I then took my blood pressure quickly and easily as directed. It appeared to be accurate, based on recent blood pressure measurements at my physician's office. I found the monitor to be simple, easy to use, and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara C. Lehman

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: No matter where I put the strap on either arm, I never got the same reading twice. In addition, a lot of the attempts were waaaaaaaaay off. Even when my husband, who has fantastic pressure, used the instrument, there were inconsistent readings. Very disappointed. When I mentioned this to my cardiologist, he said that most of these types of blood pressure monitors have similar issues. So I am not going to try to purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Shuster

customer_reviews.title: Fast reading
customer_reviews.text: I previously own two similar product. One takes too long, another one broke in 4years. Trying this one for the first time. It gave results relatively fast with easy read screen. Also had clear instruction how to properly use them. I do understand that left is closer to heart, but wasnt sure why it said to use on left arm only. Other products didn't say that before. I have used it in both arms, and it wasnt too different.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor-Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This works great although it wasn't as responsive with the batteries that came with it. We switched them out and it worked much better. I was concerned that the wrist cuff would not fit me since I'm a little chunky, but I had room to spare. My doctor has requested that I keep track of my blood pressure and this wrist monitor is SOOOO much easier than the traditional arm cuff!! If you need to keep track of your pressures I highly recommend this monitor!
customer_reviews.author: Raspberryjunkie

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, simple clear numbers to read however the Systolic Pressure reading & Diastolic Pressure both read much lower than reality. I took the device into my doctors office to confirm this and they compared it to a digital and manual device both show it was off 15/10 which is quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Wrist Digital Blood Pressure Monitor for our 85 year old parents after reading reviews that it was very easy to use. It is! They struggled using an upper arm cuff but can do this on their own with no problem. The directions (with photos) are very clear and easy to follow. It came with batteries so it was ready to go right from the box. We are very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey O'Connell

customer_reviews.title: works improperly
customer_reviews.text: The device works incorrectly. I tried it several times to get close to accurate readings. I don’t know how it received positive high reviews but it is really inaccurate. Instead recommend to buy branded regular blood pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Bakyt Zhuman

customer_reviews.title: Good clear reading
customer_reviews.text: Just received it yesterday but have used it 3-4 times and I have a fairly large wrist and it fit great and I would get almost the exact same results as with my larger one with the cuff on my arm and the numbers were very clear and easy to read,I’ve had a couple other wrist blood pressure monitors and didn’t work nearly as well as this one, I would highly recommend buying this product
customer_reviews.author: rocko1956

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Love it! Convenient and fast. Just remember to keep your arm straight and at heart level. The upper arm cuffs don't fit me well and can be painful when they keep inflaing beyond mild discomfort. Plus, I can slip it in my coat pocket and check at various times of the day. Haven't really played with the memory storage feature yet, but I plan to.
customer_reviews.author: DB in SD

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for a Convenient Device!
customer_reviews.text: Great product - glad we have it in our home for a quick BP reading! Doesn't get too tight or cause pain on the wrist like some digital, bicep location styles do and the controls are all very intuitive so it's easy to work. I appreciate the large display, time/date, and memory function so that I can track readings as I work to lower pre-hypertension. This device also comes with a nice storage case so it stays safe. I believe it to be accurate as it measures in line with another device, but I did not test it side by side with a traditional sphymomanometer. Overall worth the low cost and very convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Greg/Lyndee

customer_reviews.title: Should have returned it
customer_reviews.text: This gives three different readings for three different attempts to use it in a ten minute period. Example: 98 over 40, 148 over 78, and 102 over 56. I have small wrists but the reviews said it worked well for small wrists so I gave it the benefit of the doubt and tried changing the battery. I should have returned it but let my time to exchange it expire.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fairly priced
customer_reviews.text: Works fast and gives true results, I'm a nurse so this comes in very handy
customer_reviews.author: David Vance

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I just received the product today and so far I’m loving the product. It’s extremely easy to set up, simple to use, and thus far seems pretty accurate. My son has a heart defect so I’m very familiar with his normal BP and mine as well. I did several trials on both of us and it’s working great so far. Shipping was fast and it arrived in great condition and ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lady

customer_reviews.title: Nice design but inaccurate reading
customer_reviews.text: Readings way off compared to other larger b/p machines. Most accurate readings are manual. Wanted to quickly evaluate my b/p at various times during day to assess situational hypertension but readings too far off at baseline.
customer_reviews.author: katiedid

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this BP cuff thinking it would be easier to track the trends of my bp's to tell my doctor when looking at effective medications to use. It is VERY inaccurate. I can literally get one reading of 200/100 or so and then 30 seconds later get one that is 130/90, which is not plausible. I am so dissapointed in this product. I've gone back to my manual bp cuff, which I don't love because It's more challenging to use without assistance. Definitely not worth the money. I'm also disappointed I missed my return window by less than a week. How dissapointing Amazon. :(
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little product
customer_reviews.text: I have found that it is accurate and easy to use with clear instructions. I take frequent blood pressures on very elderly, and very thin patients and this will be very helpful. I would rate it 4 out of 5. The one suggestion I have for improvement is some option to repeat the blood pressure without turning the device off and then on again.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Briner

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: My old one wasn’t working so I had to buy a new one and I came across this blood pressure monitor it fits well on my wrist the Velcro doesn’t seem like it’s going to come loose so I’m happy about that. It came with a case so it won’t get lost in my closet and also batteries which was great because I didn’t want to have to go order more batteries right now. So far it’s working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique G

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Tested this against my regular BP cuff. Diastolic numbers were slightly different, Just a few numbers off. Compared it to my fitness bracelet very close numers as well. This was easy to use. The instructions are easy to understand. I think great product for home use. Small, compact nice to travel with. Will be adding it to my EMT jump bag.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have always used a cuff on my upper arm and was a little skeptical about using the electronic blood pressure monitor. Once I used it, according to the directions, it gave me the same reading as my other one. Not only that, when I went to the doctor, they matched. I'm very happy with it and will tell others. I got it because my son suggested I get one so I could take my bp without the hassle of using the other. Glad I did because it is much easier and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this blood pressure monitor but sadly had to return it due to inaccurate readings. We tried numerous times to get accurate readings but were unsuccessful. One time even taking it to our doctors office because the reading it gave us was so low it scared me only to find out the monitor was giving very low readings.
customer_reviews.author: Erin W

customer_reviews.title: Great way to maintain a record of your blood pressure
customer_reviews.text: This little device surprised by its simplicity and accuracy. Running in small batteries I was expecting little short battery life but to my surprise we used it for over two months every other day and it still going strong. It has a built in memory that helps keep track of your blood pressure history. I only wish one could setup users.
customer_reviews.author: bigalpdx

customer_reviews.title: wildly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I'm an EMT so I understand how to take blood pressure via auscultation but wanted something for myself that was quick and easy. I took a successive series of tests and got the following: 143/86, 178/102, 134/80, 116/77. So, nearly fifty points variance in systolic? Measured with a cuff and stethoscope, I got 164/100 which is what I expected to see (just starting treatment for HBP). Followed all their instructions – this was after resting for five minutes, sitting on the floor with my arm at heart level on a coffee table, not moving, and not repositioning the monitor between measurements. This item is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Portable handy bp equipment
customer_reviews.text: Can’t get easier to check your blood pressure anywhere/anytime. This is portable, battery operated. Make sure your battery is changed once in awhile or If not used for a month or so. This gives very close reading from the one you see in hospital, the benefit I see is it’s cheap, affordable, Hanson, portable and good test results. I have heard lot of bad things about wrist band for pressure but I realized it’s good after I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Sashank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased your (Paramed) wrist blood pressure monitor for my wife. She likes how easy it is to use. It is quiet as compared to other similar devices. The readings match the doctor’s office. It has a small profile, slick wrist-contoured design, and a storage case that is perfect for when we travel. We rate this 5 as the best machine we have observed and used, for all those things listed above. And I know the battery life is at least 6 months to a 1 year depending on how often we use it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Very Consumer/user unfriendly device
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the device to replace an upper arm cuff that was cumbersome to use. What I got was a device that is inaccurate by a significant margin, not easy to use and has virtually no user instructions. Tested against my original cuff the readings were off by as much as 25 points with the PARAMED product always showing a higher-pressure level. I took the device to CVS and checked it against the blood pressure cuff there, same result as my readings at home.
customer_reviews.author: Dilbert Speaks

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few arm cuff BP monitors, but this one is far more convenient to use. Just put on your wrist and press start. The readings appear comparable to my other monitors I've used in the past. Just make sure you follow the instructions carefully on elevating your wrist. Not yet sure how it compares to the doctor's office readings until I bring it with me on my next doctor visit.
customer_reviews.author: RB68

customer_reviews.title: Finally found a winner!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced top brand arm monitor that was all over the place, so stressful and probably added to high blood pressure. This is easy to take with you very good quality and had husband test with those at Walgreens pretty spot on. Very happy with unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mcbethie

customer_reviews.title: Get yourself one, now
customer_reviews.text: Amazing device. V. accurate, gives new insight into your health if you have not previously monitored yourself. I'm much healthier than i previously knew. Everyone should own/use one at this cheap price. Probably will get a few for gifts. Highly recommend. One note, I realize now how many tards in medical offices do the blood pressure either wrong or half-assed. As with most things, you'll benefit by doing it yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Plot Twist

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this device.
customer_reviews.text: Performs as advertised. Easy to use, intuitive and user friendly. Took it out of the box and my husband was able to take his first b/p reading following only the picture instructions inside the lid of the carry case. I double checked it with an upper arm monitor and the readings were within 3 points of each other. I will continue to double check for awhile but it seems accurate. I’m very pleased with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Pat W

customer_reviews.title: Much easier to use than arm cuff!
customer_reviews.text: The first unit I bought was defective. Error code E0(not listed in the trouble codes) Reordered a replacement and that one operated fine. I will update it later after some time.
customer_reviews.author: Cautiouslyinformed

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, does what it's intended for!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product, it's easy to use and does what I need it to do! It straps on just fine and automatically tightens and checks my blood pressure as well as pulse. The instructions on how to use it are easy to digest and the measurements seem pretty accurate. I know the typical range of my blood pressure and the device matches that just fine. I also did some breathing exercises to lower heart rate and it picked that up too when I did a before and after test. The fact that this stores measurements as well just makes things even better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have large upper arms, and I have had a lot of trouble finding a b/p cuff that fits without spending a lot of money. I was dubious about using a wrist model, feeling that it wouldn't be as accurate as an upper arm model. I was wrong. This wrist cuff is getting similar, if not identical, readings as those my doctor is getting. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AnonAmiss

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This a great BP for quick easy to use with one hand. Recommend to use on left wrist for proper reading. But easy to see big numbers. For those who have issue seeing. Also, it has a indicator bar on left, to let ya know which stage on BP your in. Red, For stage 2-4 yellow for stage 1 and green for all good BP readings. Overall great product hope it last a long time. That will be the final test. Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Christy
